summary: A command line tool (with source) that will download a list of files from any of the Nexus sites.
descriptionHtml:
This is a command line program that facilitates the batch downloading of mods. I made it because the Nexus Mod Manager has horrific download support, and I wanted to see if I could one-up it in less than a day. You be the judge on that.

It downloads files sequentially and only from one Nexus at a time, but it supports all of them. It only ever downloads the first main file- Again, I couldn\'t see any use for it myself, so I didn\'t add it (It would also be a lot of work, maybe. Or just keeping track of another number.)

USAGE:

The first argument is the Nexus you\'re downloading from- \"skyrim\", \"tes\", or what have you. Only works on one Nexus at a time.
The second is your username. I don\'t steal it, and its exactly as secure as it is over the web browser- You can check this in the source, and with a HTTP sniffer in your browser.
The third is your password. See the above argument for username.
After follows a list of file IDs that you want to download. The program will download them all sequentially. It doesn\'t make use of premium servers, mostly because I don\'t have premium and therefore my 6 hours of C coding didn\'t necessitate it.

An example:
    NexusBatchDownloader.exe skyrim whitewater this_isnt_really_my_password_or_is_it 1578

All source is under the BSD license. PCRE is additionally under the BSD license, and I believe it doesn\'t matter what license wget is under as it isn\'t linked to my program in any way.
author: Whitewater
